title: The issue that generated this was whether consent or consummation created a marriage. This was contested hotly by churchmen in the twelfth and thirteenth centuries. Gratian argued for both consent and consummation. Hugh of Saint-Victor and Peter Lombard argued for consent alone. The consensual theory finally won the day. This was stated in its fullest form by Pope Alexander III
